hackathon-description-text: The University of Oklahoma's Student Chapter ACM is proud to present Hacklahoma, its first hackathon! Students from all backgrounds, majors, and experience levels will come together to collaborate on projects that include mobile applications, virtual reality, and digital assistants in 24 hours. Anyone with an interest in technology comes to learn, build, and share their creations!

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: First place individual or team, overall.  Each team member will receive a Nintendo Switch!
Second place individual or team, overall.  Each team member will receive a Fitbit Alta!
Third place individual or team, overall.  Each team member will receive a Google Home!
Top ten individuals or teams, overall.  Each team member will receive yearlong subscriptions to Wolfram|One Personal Edition and Wolfram|Alpha Pro!
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: SPONSORED BY WOLFRAM: 1 Year Subscriptions to Wolfram|One Personal Edition and Wolfram|Alpha Pro

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Vitech will be awarding a $2000 Amazon gift card to the top individual or team who completes their sponsored hack!
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: SPONSORED BY VITECH: $2000 Amazon Gift Card

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: NextThought will be awarding a NextThought Swag Bag to the top individual or team who completes their sponsored hack, Hack Your Campus Experience! Each team member will receive a NextThought Swag Bag, full of technology accessories, branded clothing and gear.
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: SPONSORED BY NextThought: NextThought Swag Bag

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: The team submitting for this prize must be composed of all beginners!
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Best Beginner Hack: Bluetooth Jamoji Wireless Speaker

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: This prize goes to the team with the best social impact hack. This could be a positive impact for the environment, local community, social justice or more.
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Best Social Impact Hack: Skullcandy Method Bluetooth Earbuds
Amazon Web Services - Best Use of AWS

hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=110 W Boyd St, Norman, OK 73069, USA

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: What's your project's "wow" factor? How did you go above and beyond?
How much did you learn from your project? Did you have to overcome any challenges? What risks did you take?
If you complete a sponsored challenge as your hack, judging criteria is determined by the sponsor.  Please see the details of the challenge for more information on their criteria.

hackathon-location-address: 110 W Boyd St, Norman, OK 73069, USA
hackathon-location-description: University of Oklahoma - Devon Energy Hall
